Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: Jar
Description: Small globular vase with a wide but short neck and a flared lip with a triangular profile. It was made from a fine orange clay, covered with a thick white slip. It is most probable that this type of ceramic vessel contained a liquid, like the jars depicted in libation scenes in temples.
